Title: Macrofungal Diversity of Tian Shan in Kyrgyzstan
Keywords:
Ascomycota  Basidiomycota  Distribution  Diversity 
Mushroom  Mycoflora  Taxonomy
Abstract:
Very few studies concerning the mushroom flora of
Kyrgyzstan have been performed, and little is known regarding the
microbial diversity occurring at a taxonomic level in the region. In
this regard, we conducted a survey of mushroom flora between 2016 and
2018, and collected 95 specimens in Tian Shan of Kyrgyzstan. A total of
55 species, 47 genera, 24 families, 8 orders, and 2 phyla including
saprobic and symbiotic fungi were confirmed through this research. To
assure the identity of mushrooms collected from Tian Shan in Kyrgyzstan,
morphological characteristics and molecular data were applied for the
first time. The results revealed 55 species that are previously
undescribed and unreported from the region.
